Sub:-
Coronavirus has been declared a global health emergenry with its epicenter in
China. It spreads the same way as the other cold-causing viruses do i.e. through
infected people coughing and sneezing, by touching an infected person's hands or face
or by touching things that infected people have touched like doorknobs etc.
2. 
Airports being the direct interface with the travelers from other countries as well
as within India, are more prone to the spread of this virus. CISF personnel deployed at
the airpofts, work in close proximity to the passengers. Thus, there is a need to
adequately sensitlze them while working at the airports. Some Dos and Don'ts have
been prepared for ASG personnel to prevent Coronavirus infection which are enclosed
herewith in Bilingual language (English and Hindi).
3. 
All CASOS are hereby directed to sensitize the ASG personnel adequately and
brief them to follow the enclosed Dos and Don'ts to prevent Coronavirus infection.
These Dos and Don'ts should be briefed to the shift personnel during lean hours and
also be displayed at prominent locations like Unit line, Notice Board, Recreation Rooms,
Mess etc. The CASOs should also brief the precautionary points during the Sainik
Sammelan to the maximum Unit personnel. The personnel should also encourage their
family members to adhere to the Dos and Don'ts.
4. 
IG/APS-I & II and all DIsG will ensure meticulous implementation of above
directions at the ASGs under their respective jurisdiction.
